field.label: Name
field.help: Name to identify this rule.

field.label: Description
field.help: Description for this rule.

field.label: Test type
field.help: Choose how to test. By using IF it tests if the condition evaluates to true. If you use UNLESS, the sense of the test is reversed.

field.label: Select conditions
field.help: Select one or more conditions to be used for this rule.

field.label: Logical operator for conditions
field.help: Choose a logical operator.

field.label: Execute function
field.help: Choose a HAProxy function that should be executed if the condition evaluates to true.

field.label: Use backend pool
field.help: HAProxy will use this backend pool if the condition evaluates to true.

field.label: Use server
field.help: HAProxy will use this server instead of other servers that are specified in the Backend Pool. The server must exist in the context where this rule is applied.

field.label: NOTE: The specified server must be present in the Backend Pool where this rule is applied.
Auth Realm
field.help: When HAProxy requests user name and password from the user, this optiomal authentication realm is returned with the response (typically the application's name).

field.label: HTTP Redirect
field.help: Use HAProxy's redirect function to return a HTTP redirection. See HAProxy's documentation for further details and examples.

field.label: Lua function
field.help: Execute the specified Lua function. You will most likely need to include/load your Lua code first.

field.label: Lua service
field.help: Register the specified Lua service. You will most likely need to include/load your Lua code first.

field.label: HTTP Header

field.label: Header Content
field.help: The value that should be set for the specified HTTP header. Note that it is possible to use pre-defined variables, see HAProxy's documentation for further details and examples.

field.label: HTTP Header
